revised_title: Rotatory Motion and its Applications: A Study on Prime and Ultimate Ratios
tldr: The author, W. Gravatt, explores the subject of rotatory motion using prime and ultimate ratios. He explains the motion of a peg-top, the effect of axial rotation on a falling body, and the deviation of a cannonball's flight due to the Earth's rotation. Gravatt also critiques the famous experiment by M. Foucault, demonstrating the Earth's rotation, due to the minute errors that could affect the results.
